Package de.dhbw.ravensburg.zuul

Class Game

java.lang.Object
de.dhbw.ravensburg.zuul.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the main class of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. Users can walk around some scenery. That's all. It should really be extended to make it more interesting! To play this game, create an instance of this class and call the "play" method. This main class creates and initialises all the others: it creates all rooms, creates the parser and starts the game. It also evaluates and executes the commands that the parser returns.
Version:
2016.02.29
Author:
Michael KÃ¶lling and David J. Barnes

  • Method Details

    • createRooms

      private void createRooms()
      Create all the rooms and link their exits together.

    • play

      public void play()
      Main play routine. Loops until end of play.

    • printWelcome

      private void printWelcome()
      Print out the opening message for the player.

    • processCommand

      private boolean processCommand​(Command command)
      Given a command, process (that is: execute) the command.
      Parameters:
      command - The command to be processed.
      Returns:
      true If the command ends the game, false otherwise.

    • printHelp

      private void printHelp()
      Print out some help information. Here we print some stupid, cryptic message and a list of the command words.

    • goRoom

      private void goRoom​(Command command)
      Try to in to one direction. If there is an exit, enter the new room, otherwise print an error message.

    • quit

      private boolean quit​(Command command)
      "Quit" was entered. Check the rest of the command to see whether we really quit the game.
      Returns:
      true, if this command quits the game, false otherwise.
